title: Props in React
description: Learn how components talk to each other using props

intro.title: Message Delivery Mission
intro.story: Components are lonely if they cannot talk. Props help them send messages safely.
intro.preview: You will learn how data flows from parent to child.

refresher.title: üì¶ Real-World Story: School Bag
refresher.content:
# Imagine a School

A parent gives a school bag to a child.

Inside the bag:
- Books
- Lunch box
- Water bottle

The child **uses** the items.
But the child **cannot change** what the parent packed.

---

## Same in React

- Parent component sends data
- Child component receives data
- This data is called **props**

---

## What are Props?

Props are **inputs** to a component.

They make components **dynamic** and **reusable**.

positive.title: ‚úÖ Passing Props
positive.description: Parent sends a name to child component.
positive.explanation: The App component sends `name`. The Welcome component receives it using props.

concept.title: üß† Props Rules
concept.content:
## Important Rules

1. Props are read-only
2. Child cannot modify props
3. Props flow from parent to child

---

Think of props like exam question paper.
You can read it.
You cannot change it.

negative.title: üêõ Wrong Usage
negative.question: What is the mistake?

options.explanation: Correct. Props should never be changed inside child components.

negative.lesson: Props are like gifts. You can use them, not change them.
